section_program.heading: Program Scope
entries: Fil+ is designed for all client actors with quality data who engage in distributed onboarding.

Client actors can be either data owners or preparers (including SPs), who either provide some form of KYC (and KYB) information to earn social trust or prove long term commitment (i.e., collateral in a trustless notary)

Quality data is all content that meets local regulatory requirements and
  • the data owner wants to see on the network, including private/encrypted data
  • or is open and retrievable
  • or demonstrates proof of concept or utility of the network, such as efforts to improve onboarding
Distributed onboarding is generally defined as: multiple physical locations and multiple storage provider entities to serve client requirements

page_content.roadmap_subheading: Guiding program quality, transparency and enablement

events.text: Public potential data abuse dashboard / tracking % of quality onboarded data
Public dispute tracker
Dispute Resolution Framework v2
Public roadmap shared, key deliverables shared on landing page
Updated DataCap tracking on datacapstats.io, client explorer
Medium publication for Fil+ with internal team process for frequent updates
filplus.storage v2 - client application tracking, improved UX, metrics
Proposal to remove LDN application max
Notary due diligence tracking for accountability & efficiency
Deliver notary capability to remove DataCap from client addresses
KYC/KYB integrations in client onboarding LDN flow
Public dashboard on notary tooling reliability
Public dashboard on client applications
Notary leaderboard to include Notary due diligence actions
Improvements to increase the reliability of onboarding bots and apps for notaries & clients
Kick-off design discussion on potential trustless notaries
Bots testing retrievals on open data
New automated abuse explorers to easily spot abuse
Automated dispute escalation of bad notary behavior based on the diligence tracker
Public retrieval dashboards
Fil+ Day
Improvements to E-Fil+ process (deeper KYB, higher standard, enable quicker subsequent allocations)
Changes to LDN processes to better map to observed client use-case types and needs
Kick off discussions on longer-term efforts around incentives
